title: Can I become a forensics scientist with a bachelor's degree in physics? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi, You would be happy to hear. Yes, having bachelors degree in Physics with two years of Experience as lab technician can get you job as Scientific Officer - Physics Department and Having BSc degree can get job in Fingerprint Bureau or laboratory Technician - Physics Department, Also, there are few certifications which can help you in getting job as Forensic Scientist - Provided by IFS - Mumbai and GFSU Gujarat. The best way is you go for MSc in Forensic Science and then you would be eligible for much more positions in different fields.

I was originally going to say yes, but after reviewing the educational requirements for eight randomly selected forensic scientist positions across various forensic disciplines, it appears that the answer is actually no. You need coursework in chemistry in every one of the postings and in many of them you also need coursework in biology.
